character.name: version
character.description: Always has value "TP02" ("TP" plus version number), no null terminator.

integer.name: sequence
integer.description: An incrementing number "sequence number". The sequence number should always be one more then the previous frames sequence number.

packet.name: Okay
packet.description: A request was successful in some sort of way.

string.name: result
string.description: The string can be safely ignored (However it may contain useful information for debugging purposes).
string.example: Order was created successfully in slot 1.

packet.name: Fail
packet.description: A request has failed in some sort of way.

values.value: Something went wrong with the protocol
One of the frames sent was bad or corrupted
This operation is unavailable at this moment
You don't have permission to do this operation

string.name: result
string.example: Order was created successfully in slot 1.

notes.note: If the connect frame is not valid TP frame, this frame will not be returned, instead a plain text string will be sent saying that the wrong protocol has been used. A fail frame may be send if the wrong protocol version is detected. This does not affect clients as they should always get the connect frame right.

packet.name: Sequence
packet.description: Frame which says that there are multiple frames coming in response to the request.

string.name: number
string.description: Number of frames which will follow this one.

packet.name: GetWithID
packet.description: This packet is used to get things using their IDs. Such things would be objects, message boards, etc.

packet.name: GetWithIDSlot
packet.description: This packet is used to get things which are in "slots" on a parent. Examples would be orders (on objects), messages (on boards), etc.

list.name: slots
list.description: The slots on the thing to get.

notes.note: An empty list is equivalent to requesting all slots.
If this is really a Remove frame then slot numbers should be in decrementing value if you don't want strange things to happen. (IE 10, 4, 1)
